Are you sure you want to delete this Brief?
Define the area in which the task will be undertaken, including any hazards and restricting factors.
A general background of the task and the time the task needs to be completed by.
A short concise statement detailing the task, who is to complete it and when it needs to be completed by. (When giving orders this is stated twice).

How the task is going to be completed. This can include, but is not limited to:

General Outline:
  • A word picture i.e. this task will be conducted in three stages.
  • Move to the task site, the completion of the task and the move back to the base location.
Detailed Tasks:
  • Any specific tasks allocated to groups or sub groups for each stage.
Coordinating Instructions:
  • Timings critical to the tasks.
  • Limitations and restrictions.
Actions On:
  • What to do if lost, injured etc.
  • Safety.

Additional factors that may impact the task. This can include, but is not limited to:
  • Administration and Logistics in support of the completion of the task.
  • Meal timings and location.
  • Rest periods.
  • Accommodation.
  • Equipment.
  • Dress.
  • Medical.

Who will be talking to who and how this will be done. This can include, but is not limited to:
  • Command channels.
  • Communication channels.
